group_1.narration: I was trying to think about@what things I enjoy doing most,@but I can't come up with anything.
I used to milk the yaks and make butter,@but I didn't do those things because I enjoyed them.
I just did it because it was my job.@I had no feelings about it.@I don't even care all that much@about tending to the animals.
But...knowing I can't do those things anymore@makes me feel a little empty inside.
"...Sorry to keep you waiting.@I've finished gathering all the ashes."
I put everyone's remains in the most@beautiful urn that survived the fire...@But since they weren't cremated,@they were black and not proper ashes.
I wanted to give them a true cremation,@but there was no place to do so in our village,@where wind burials were custom.@I had no choice but to gather them as they were.
In this urn, everyone is mixed together…@My mother and father, too…surely.
"...Do you hate the Mongol Empire?@Knowing how they ravaged your home..."
The high priest who helped us, the Lama,@whom many in the monastery revered as a guru,@asked me that in a sad voice.
I answered with, "I don't know,"@and he looked even more sad.
"Heruka..."
The girl who called out to me was named Dolma,@who had survived along with me.
We've been friends our whole lives,@born on the same day, living together@for as long as we've known, and...
…the only person I saved.
"I hate Mongolia…!"
Hate? I wonder what that feels like?

group_1.textCenter: The Mongols will attack us soon.
That's right! We'll get our revenge on those@loathsome Mongols!

group_1.narration: ...A long time has passed since then,@but even now, I still don't quite understand@how it feels to hate someone.
Even though they're the people@who stole my family and home, I...

group_1.textLeft: But how are we supposed to beat them?

group_1.textRight: It'll be okay!@We have Heruka on our side…

group_1.narration: I am the savior who will overcome the Mongols@and bring Shambhala to the land of Tibet…
…Even if I must be a Rakshasi.

group_1.textRight: We have a suspicious intruder on our grounds...@They might be with the Mongols!
